title: Apple Watch 2024 guide: Apple Watch Series 10 launch date, features, specs and more
content:
Macworld

Want to know all about the newest Apple Watches? They are coming soon!

Apple has updated the Apple Watch for 2024. We are updating this article as the news is breaking. Please click here for the latest version.

What we expected:

  • Apple Watch 10: Larger screens and thinner bodies, new AI-ready processor.
  • Apple Watch Ultra: New ‘black/dark’ color scheme, S10 SiP processor, new Digital Crown with touch-sensitive elements and light sensors.
  • Apple Watch SE: S9 SiP processor, 41/45mm display sizes.

The Apple Watch 10 has been updated, but it doesn’t have a new processor. The Apple Watch Ultra gets a new finish and some other new capabilities, but the watch itself hasn’t been updated. The same is true of the Apple Watch SE.

New Apple Watch release date: When do the new Apple Watches come out?

The Apple Watch Series 10 was announced at Apple’s September 2024 event https://www.macworld.com/article/831417/apple-september-iphone-event-date-time.html on September 9.

New Apple Watch Series 10 – on sale date

Pre order from September 9.
On sale from September 20.

New Apple Watch Ultra – on sale date

Pre order from September 9.
On sale from September 20.

New Apple Watch SE – on sale date

Pre order from September 9.
On sale from September 20.

New Apple Watch prices: How much will the Apple Watches cost?

Here are Apple’s prices of the new Apple Watches:

  • Apple Watch Series 10: From $399/£399
  • Apple Watch Ultra: From $799/£799
  • Apple Watch SE: From $249/£219 (TBC)

Want to buy a new Apple Watch? Don’t pay more than you need to! We have also collected the best deals for the Apple Watch in a separate articles. https://www.macworld.com/article/672795/best-apple-watch-deals.html

These prices are the same as the 2023 Apple Watch models. Pricing for the previous generation was as follows:

  • Apple Watch Series 9: from $399/£399
  • Apple Watch Ultra 2, from $799/£799
  • Apple Watch SE from $249/£219 (was £259 at launch)

The Apple Watch Series 9 models have all been discontinued.

Should I buy an Apple Watch Series 10?

The answer to this question depends on a lot of things, including the watch you are upgrading from, your budget, and the features that you need from a smartwatch. We have various articles that attempt to answer the question, see links below.

For help choosing the best Apple Watch for you read our Apple Watch comparison https://www.macworld.com/article/671574/best-apple-watch.html where we help you device which Apple Watch best meets your needs.

You may also be wondering if you need a cellular watch, in which case read Should I buy a cellular Apple Watch. https://www.macworld.com/article/230395/lte-apple-watch-pros-cons.html

New Apple Watch Design: Do the 2024 Apple Watches look different?

The new Apple Watch Series 10 boasts some design changes from the previous generation.

Screen

The new Apple Watch Series 10 screen is larger than the Apple Watch Series 9 screen was. In fact it is Apple’s biggest ever Apple Watch display – bigger even than the Apple Watch Ultra.

It’s also Apple’s first wide angle OLED display. This new technology should make the display more power-efficient, thus preserving battery life.

The pixels will also emit more light at any angle – which is a benefit since most people view their watches from different angles.

It also means that the always-on display can update once a second, not once a minute.
